alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Sumner; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 1:57AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Davidson, southwestern Sumner and Wilson Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 157 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Madison, or 7 miles northeast of Nashville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Madison, Hendersonville, Mount Juliet, Goodlettsville, Lakewood, Hermitage, Rural Hill, Belinda City, Old Hickory, Green Hill, Tuckers Crossroads, Dickerson Chapel Recreation Area, Cedars Of Lebanon State Park, Percy Priest Lake and Gladeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 217 and 245. Interstate 65 between mile markers 86 and 99. Interstate 24 between mile markers 40 and 48. Interstate 840 between mile markers 68 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
